comments.body: Do you need to pass around FullName once you have UUID?
Yes please make it so you don't have to pass more than one thing to identify a pod.

Passing PodFullName to maintain the backward compatibility. Current support is you can passing name or name/uuid. 

Actually the current support is invoked through Kubelet's HTTP api: /proxy/minion/$host/run/$podname/<$uuid>/$containerName?cmd=...

If we decided to make sure name is required and unique in the space, I prefer to take podName only from HTTP request, then find the only running container which matches to podName, and call RunInContainer with uuid here.
I guess compat is a good reason, for now, but longer term we should only need 1.
Suggestion: hash the UUID and make it part of PodFullName, which will solve multiple complaints at once, I think?

I started from this, but ditch that solution due to the following reasons:

1) It is not name indeed. Name is used to maintain the space uniqueness, not time uniqueness
2) It is harder for me to make backward compatibility for now. We eventually want to refactor the API, which means we might break the compatibility later, but not with this PR. 
3) When taking HTTP request with a running container (for example, run_in_container), the user could pass podname and containername without user-unfriendly UUID here. To hash the UUID and make it part of PodFullName makes this almost impossible.
